Posts.Content: squidlife4me wrote:   I found a lump about 5 months ago in my right breast.  I really shrugged it off until about a month ago when I noticed it was getting a little larger.  I have had nipple discharge for a long time, but brushed it off because I nursed my twins up until about a year and a half ago.  I figured it was just residual or something.. turns out .. not.     I saw my pcm who referred me to the breast health clinic.  They did an ultrasound and found I have a 3cm lump.  They were not able to see exactly what it was so wanted me to have the biopsy done.        I have been to the breast health clinic twice for lumps and have just been told they were fine..so when they said biospy this time.. it was a little unnerving.    I am young (29ish), the mom to 3 boys, and married to a military man.        I had the resident radiologist tell me he believes its an intraductoral (sp??) Papilloma , then his boss came in and did some blood flow scan thing (???)  and said he felt like it could be something else.  He reassured me that women of my age seldomly have problems and sent me for a mammo.   The mammo didnt show the area at all (he didnt believe it would due to the dense tissue.        I am the "strong" one in my family.. the one that holds it all together.  My husband returned in December from a 7 month long deployment.  I consider myself a pretty strong person.. but I am having a really hard time with this.          I am more worried about the procedure than anything else.. LOL.  I HATE HATE HATE needles and having a needle poked into my boob is scaring the hell out of me.           Can an anti-anxiety med be taken before the procedure?  I am thinking of calling them to ask if they can give me something to ease my nerves a little.           THe biopsy is the 16th and I will get the results on the 22nd (of Feb.).
